example.description: Locks the player's view to only vertical movement.
example.code:
hook.Add("InputMouseApply", "LockToPitchOnly", function( ccmd, x, y, angle )
	-- By leaving angle.roll and angle.yaw alone, we effectively lock them
	angle.pitch = math.Clamp( angle.pitch + y / 50, -89, 89 )
	ccmd:SetViewAngles( angle )
	return true
end)

function.description: Removes all players that are not on the given team from the filter.

arg.text: Team index.
arg.name: teamid

function.name: RemoveRecipientsByTeam
function.description: Removes all players that are on the given team from the filter.

arg.text: Team index to remove players from.
arg.name: teamid

function.name: RemovePVS
function.description: Removes all players that can see this PVS from the recipient filter.

arg.text: Position that players may be able to see.
arg.name: pos

example.description: Adds the first player object to the recipient filter, then sends him a message.
example.code:
function SendMessage()
	local filter = RecipientFilter()
	filter:AddPVS( Vector( 0,0,0 ) )
	filter:RemovePVS( Vector( 0,10,0 ) )
	umsg.Start( "message", filter )
	umsg.End()
end
example.output: Adds all players that can see the map's origin to the recipient filter, then removes all players who can see 10 units to the left of the origin, and sends the rest a message.

function.name: RemovePlayer
function.description: Removes the player from the recipient filter.

arg.text: The player that should be in the recipient filter if you call this function.
arg.name: Player

example.description: Adds all players to the recipient filter, then removes the first player and sends a message to the rest.
example.code:
util.AddNetworkString("message")
function SendMessage()
	local filter = RecipientFilter()
	filter:AddAllPlayers()
	filter:RemovePlayer(Entity(1))
	net.Start("message")
	net.Send(filter)
end
example.output: Sends a net message to every player except the first.

function.name: RemovePAS

arg.text: The position to test
arg.name: position

arg.name: damage

function.name: RemoveAllPlayers
function.description: Removes all players from the recipient filter.

example.description: Adds all players that can see the origin of the map, removes all players, then adds the first player object to the recipient filter, and sends them a message.
example.code:
function SendMessage()
 local filter = RecipientFilter()
 filter:AddPVS(Vector(0,0,0))
 filter:RemoveAllPlayers()
 filter:AddPlayer(Entity(1))
 umsg.Start("message",filter)
 umsg.End()
end
example.output: Sends a usermessage to the first player object, if it exists.

function.name: GetPlayers
function.description: Returns a table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

ret.text: A table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

example.description: Example usage of the function
example.code:
local rf = RecipientFilter()
rf:AddAllPlayers()
print( rf:GetCount() )
PrintTable( rf:GetPlayers() )

function.description: Returns the number of valid players in the recipient filter.

local rf = RecipientFilter()
rf:AddAllPlayers()
print( rf:GetCount() )

function.name: AddPVS
function.description: Adds all players that are in the same PVS as this position.

arg.text: PVS position.
arg.name: Position

example.description: Adds players that are visible from the origin of the map to a recipient filter, then sends them a message.
example.code:
function SendMessage()
	local filter = RecipientFilter()
	filter:AddPVS( Vector( 0, 0, 0 ) )
	umsg.Start( "message", filter )
	umsg.End()
end
example.output: Sends a usermessage to every player visible from 0,0,0

function.name: AddPlayer
function.description: Adds a player to the recipient filter

arg.text: Player to add to the recipient filter.
arg.name: Player

example.description: Adds the first player object to the recipient filter, then sends him a message.
example.code:
function SendMessage()
 local filter = RecipientFilter()
 filter:AddPlayer(Entity(1))
 umsg.Start("message",filter)
 umsg.End()
end
example.output: Sends a usermessage to the first player object, if it exists.

function.name: AddAllPlayers
function.description: Adds all players to the recipient filter.

example.description: Adds all players to a recipient filter, then uses the recipient filter in a usermessage.
example.code:
function SendMessage()
	local filter = RecipientFilter()
	filter:AddAllPlayers()
	umsg.Start("message",filter)
	umsg.End()
end
example.output: Sends a usermessage to every player.

description.text:
Returns a table of good hiding spots in this area.

See also .

arg.text:
The type of spots to include.

* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff, same as GetExposedSpots
* Values over 255 and below 0 will be clamped.

function.name: AddHidingSpot
function.description:
Adds a hiding spot onto this nav area.

There's a limit of 255 hiding spots per area.

arg.text: The position on the nav area
arg.name: pos

arg.text:
Flags describing what kind of hiding spot this is.
* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff

Values over 255 will be clamped.

description.text:
Sets the maximum speed of the player. This must match with  both, on server and client.


Doesn't seem to be doing anything on it's own, use  instead.

arg.name: maxSpeed

description.text:
Sets the maximum player speed. Player won't be able to run or sprint faster then this value.


This also automatically sets  when used in the  hook. You must set it manually in the  hook.


This must be called on both client and server to avoid prediction errors.


This will **not** reduce speed in air.
description.note: Setting this to 0 will not make the player stationary. It won't do anything.

arg.text: The new maximum speed
arg.name: maxSpeed

example.description: Doesn't let the player to run or sprint faster than 100 units per second.
Doubles the players speed properly.
example.code:
hook.Add( "Move", "testestst", function( ply, mv, usrcmd )
	local speed = mv:GetMaxSpeed() * 2
	mv:SetMaxSpeed( speed )
	mv:SetMaxClientSpeed( speed )
end )

arg.text:
Collide callback, the arguments are:

 hitPos - Position of the collision

 hitNormal - Direction of the collision, perpendicular to the hit surface
arg.name: collideFunc

example.description: Creates an explosion every time an particle collides with something.
example.code:
MyParticle:SetCollideCallback( function( part, hitpos, hitnormal ) --This is an in-line function
    local efdata = EffectData() --Grab base EffectData table
    efdata:SetOrigin( hitpos ) --Sets the origin of it to the hitpos of the particle
    util.Effect( "Explosion", efdata ) --Create the effect
end )

ret.text: Damage type of the effect, see

function.name: GetEntIndex
function.description: Returns the entity index of the entity set for the effect.

ret.text: The entity index of the entity set for the effect.

function.name: GetColor
function.description: Returns byte which represents the color of the effect.

ret.text: The color of the effect

function.name: GetAttachment
function.description: Returns the attachment ID for the effect.

ret.text: The attachment ID of the effect.

function.name: Reset
function.description: Rewinds the bitstream so it can be read again.

function.name: GetAngles
function.description: Returns the angles of the effect.

ret.text: The angles of the effect

function.name: ReadVectorNormal
function.description: Reads a special encoded vector normal from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send vectors that represent a position.

ret.text: normal

function.name: ReadVector
function.description: Reads a special encoded vector from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send normals.

ret.text: vec

function.name: ReadShort
function.description: Reads a 2 byte short from the bitstream and returns it.

ret.text: short

function.name: ReadFloat
function.description: Reads a 4 byte float from the bitstream and returns it.

ret.text: float

function.name: ReadString
function.description: Reads a null terminated string from the bitstream.

ret.text: str

function.name: ReadLong
function.description: Reads a 4 byte long from the bitstream and returns it.

ret.text: int

function.name: ReadBool
function.description: Reads 1 bit an returns a bool representing the bit.

ret.text: bit

function.name: ReadChar
function.description: Reads a signed char and returns a number from -127 to 127 representing the ascii value of that char.

ret.text: asciiVal

function.name: ReadEntity
function.description: Reads a short representing an entity index and returns the matching entity handle.

ret.text: ent

function.name: ReadAngle
function.description: Reads an returns an angle object from the bitstream.

ret.text: The read angle

function.name: Zero
function.description:
Sets pitch, yaw and roll to 0.
This function is faster than doing it manually.

function.name: ToTable
function.description: Returns the angle as a table with three elements.

ret.text: The table with elements 1 = p, 2 = y, 3 = r.

function.name: Up
function.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points up relative to the angle's direction.

ret.text: The up direction of the angle.

function.name: Up
function.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points up relative to the angle's direction.

ret.text: The up direction of the angle.

function.name: Sub
function.description: Subtracts the values of the argument angle to the orignal angle. This functions the same as angle1 - angle2 without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arg.text: The angle to subtract.
arg.name: angle

description.text: Snaps the angle to nearest interval of degrees.
description.note: This will modify the original angle too!

arg.text: The component/axis to snap. Can be either "p"/"pitch", "y"/"yaw" or "r"/"roll".
arg.name: axis

arg.text: The target angle snap interval
arg.name: target

ret.text: The snapped angle.

example.description: Example usage
example.code:
print( Angle( 0, 92, 0 ):SnapTo( "y", 90 ) )
print( Angle( 0, 115, 0 ):SnapTo( "y", 45 ) )
print( Angle( 12, 98, 167 ):SnapTo( "p", 30 ):SnapTo( "y", 45 ):SnapTo( "r", 45 ) )

function.name: SetUnpacked
function.description: Sets the p, y, and r of the angle.

arg.text: The pitch component of the Angle
arg.name: p

arg.text: The yaw component of the Angle
arg.name: y

arg.text: The roll component of the Angle
arg.name: r

function.name: Set
function.description: Copies pitch, yaw and roll from the second angle to the first.

arg.text: The angle to copy the values from.
arg.name: originalAngle

function.name: RotateAroundAxis
function.description: Rotates the angle around the specified axis by the specified degrees.

arg.text: The axis to rotate around.
arg.name: axis

arg.text: The degrees to rotate around the specified axis.
arg.name: rotation

function.name: Right
function.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points right relative to the angle's direction.

ret.text: The right direction of the angle

function.name: Normalize
function.description: Normalizes the angles by applying a module with 360 to pitch, yaw and roll.

example.description: Example usage of the function
example.code:
local a = Angle( 0, 181, 1 )
a:Normalize()
print( a )

function.name: Mul
function.description: Multiplies a scalar to all the values of the orignal angle. This functions the same as num * angle without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arg.text: The number to multiply.
arg.name: scalar
